bioghist.p: John Coventry Smith (1903-1984) served as a missionary in Japan from 1929 until the outbreak of World War II. For a ten-year period both before and after the union of the Presbyterian Church in the USA, Smith was secretary for Japan, Korea, Philippines, and Thailand, and then was associate general secretary of what became the Commission on Ecumenical Mission and Relations (COEMAR). He became COEMAR's general secretary in 1959 and retired in 1970. From 1968 to 1975, he was president of the World Council of Churches. In 1968, he was elected Moderator of the General Assembly of the United Presbyterian Church USA.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of papers of John Coventry Smith. Papers related to the National Council of the Churches of Christ in the United States of America (NCC) include memoranda, correspondence, reports, and proposals. Many of the papers are from the General Board, the Executive Committee, the Division of Foreign Missions, and the Division of Overseas Ministries of the NCC, 1959-1969. Materials related to the World Council of Churches (WCC) include minutes, memoranda, reports, proposals, summaries, agendas, budgets, directories, a small amount of correspondence, and printed materials. Much of the material is related to the Executive Committee, the Division of World Mission and Evangelism, the Central Committee, and various Assemblies of the World Council of Churches, 1949-1969. Papers from the International Missionary Council include reports, memoranda, correspondence, minutes (some printed), and discussion papers.
